channel.title: Quit Yer Bitchin', Valve annouces a L4D DLC
channel.description:
[url]https://store.steampowered.com/news/2708/[/url] [quote] Crash Course Campaign Due in September
August 4, 2009 - Valve, creators of best-selling game franchises (such as Half-Life, Portal, Team Fortress, and Counter-Strike) and leading technologies (such as Steam and Source), today announced the next major downloadable content (DLC) update for its co-operative zombie thriller, Left 4 Dead (L4D), the #1 new game title on Xbox 360 and PC in 2008
Entitled "Crash Course," the latest DLC delivers new single-player, multiplayer and co-operative gameplay to both platforms. Targeted for release in September, "Crash Course" bridges the gap between the end of the "No Mercy" campaign and the beginning of "Death Toll" in the original game, expanding the game universe with new locations, new dialogue from the original cast, and an explosive finale
While containing both Survival maps and a Co-operative Campaign, the primary goal of "Crash" is to deliver a complete Versus mode experience in just 30 minutes, resulting in a streamlined version of the game's existing Versus campaigns. A recharge timer for infected teammates has also been added, and item spawn behavior has changed for more balanced gameplay.
"Since the release of Left 4 Dead last November, the design team has been excited about creating new experiences for this world and allowing players to do the same, by releasing much of our internal toolset, like the Survival Pack and Authoring Tools," said Gabe Newell. "We're working with the fans toward the ongoing entertainment value of the product."
Left 4 Dead is an action horror game from Valve that blends the social entertainment experience of multiplayer games such as Counter-Strike and Team Fortress with the dramatic, narrative experience made popular in single player action game classics such as the Half-Life series of games. Released in November of 2008, L4D has earned over 50 industry awards from outlets around the world and sold almost 3 million copies worldwide.
Left 4 Dead: Crash Course is targeted for release in September and will be available free of charge on the PC and for 560 Gamer points on Xbox Live.
For more information, please visit [url]https://www.l4d.com[/url] [/quote]

item.description:
ANYWAYS…

Jambo:

So you only ever played the 4 campaigns once and then never played them again?
=\

Nah, im just pointing out that its not even a fully fledged campaign, and likely wont hold our interest for too long. Keyword likely. Its not out yet, so im not going to pass judgement on it yet.

Listen I am sorry if I offended you…

nah you never offended me. I don’t care 'bout what people say 'bout me the internet. Or what people say 'bout me in general.

item.title: Quit Yer Bitchin', Valve annouces a L4D DLC
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
Say what you want about my tactics or my tone. I brought up valid points and addressed every argument asked of me.
Listen I am sorry if I offended you. I lashed out in an inappropriate manor personally . Personal attacks have no place in conversations debating a point. Just in the future try to contribute to the conversation if you are going to jump in and be a part of it okay?

Read full topic
item.source: Quit Yer Bitchin', Valve annouces a L4D DLC

item.title: Quit Yer Bitchin', Valve annouces a L4D DLC
item.dc:creator: Mr.Shadow
item.description:
MaxTheLimit:

You are defending jackass behavior. Shut up.
If you had bothered reading the thread you would notice that I was sticking to the core of the subject I was requested to discuss.
I’m sorry if I don’t support your empathy for people who act like idiots.
There is a difference between not following ‘a line of thinking’ and not comprehending simple deductive logic.

Who’s the jackass? The guy who spends time arguing on the internet,
or the other guy who say’s something 'bout,for example,the L4D2 boycott without saying stuff like being stupid,retarded or whatever and did virtually nothing wrong?

Read full topic
item.source: Quit Yer Bitchin', Valve annouces a L4D DLC

item.title: Quit Yer Bitchin', Valve annouces a L4D DLC
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
saivert:

and for MaxTheLimit: I’m sure you are very good at making arguments, but when you talk like you do to someone who might not follow your line of thinking, like the way you did with Mr. Shadow you come off as rather arrogant. It’s things like that that might lead to flamewars and senseless discussions that often lose track of the core of the subject.
It’s nice to step back once in a while and rethink what you just wrote.
And that goes for every one of us. I’m not singling you out on that one. I have my own flaws. I’m just writing this because I have faced off against similar people a lot before. I know exactly how Mr. Shadow felt back there.

You are defending jackass behavior. Shut up.
If you had bothered reading the thread you would notice that I was sticking to the core of the subject I was requested to discuss.
I’m sorry if I don’t support your empathy for people who act like idiots.
There is a difference between not following ‘a line of thinking’ and not comprehending simple deductive logic.

Read full topic
item.source: Quit Yer Bitchin', Valve annouces a L4D DLC

item.title: Quit Yer Bitchin', Valve annouces a L4D DLC
item.dc:creator: saivert
item.description:
I guess the boycotters lost perspective of things.

I really enjoyed ram’s timeline. The man speaks the truth. But hard facts rarely if ever changed how people felt about things. A feeling sticks pretty fast and it’s hard to get rid of. So If people feel that Valve let them down they will continue to feel that no matter what people say or do.

I guess a while after the release of Left 4 Dead 2, things will settle and people will feel stupid. And hopefully forget this thing. It’s pretty unique situation when you come to think of it. I have never seen such a debacle before.

I still use my CS 1.6 vs CS: Source comparison. People still play both.

and for MaxTheLimit: I’m sure you are very good at making arguments, but when you talk like you do to someone who might not follow your line of thinking, like the way you did with Mr. Shadow you come off as rather arrogant. It’s things like that that might lead to flamewars and senseless discussions that often lose track of the core of the subject.
It’s nice to step back once in a while and rethink what you just wrote.
And that goes for every one of us. I’m not singling you out on that one. I have my own flaws. I’m just writing this because I have faced off against similar people a lot before. I know exactly how Mr. Shadow felt back there.

I’m a peace person!

Read full topic
